title: Statue Of Liberty National Monument: Early European Use of Islands
body: Early European Use of Liberty and Ellis Islands         Historic Structure Report for Fort Wood National Park Service, Statue of Liberty NM  Early European use of Liberty and Ellis Islands, including the construction of Fort Wood and Fort Gibson as part of the military defense system of New York Information on the architecture and historic structure of Fort Wood can be accessed in the museum archives, summarized in the Fort Wood Historic Structure Report. The history of Fort Gibson is available for research in the archeology survey report in the library and museum collection. In addition to reports, the archives also have copies of the original technical drawings of the forts and their accompanying support buildings.       A monograph for the 1993 archeological dig for the Wall of Honor National Park Service, Statue of Liberty NM        Blueprint of the powder magazine in Fort Wood National Park Service, Statue of Liberty NM       < Archeology | Back to Museum Collection | History of Statue of Liberty >
